item.title: Why Human + AI Is Not Always Better
item.dc:creator: Yonas Gebre
item.description:
• Common belief that AI + humans should always improve performance
  • Why this assumption feels intuitive
  • Brief statement that research challenges this idea

What Research Shows About Human–AI Collaboration

  • Description of the study and how it compares humans, AI, and human–AI teams
  • Presentation of the main result using a simplified figure
  • Explanation of what the figure shows in plain language

Why Working With AI Can Make Results Worse

People Struggle to Use AI Correctly

  • Trusting AI too much
  • Ignoring AI when it is helpful
  • Why these behaviors are predictable

The Type of Task Matters

  • Decision tasks vs creative tasks
  • Why collaboration works better in some settings than others

Skill Differences Between Humans and AI

  • What happens when AI is better than humans
  • What happens when humans are better than AI

Why This Matters in Real Life

  • Implications for students, professionals, and everyday AI users
  • How to think more carefully about using AI tools

Conclusion

  • Summary of the key lesson
  • Why good human–AI collaboration is a design problem, not just a technology problem

item.title: Welcome To My Blog
item.dc:creator: Tristan O'Malley
item.description:
This is the first post in a Quarto blog. Welcome!

Since this post doesn’t specify an explicit image, the first image in the post will be used in the listing page of posts.
